name: m-methoxyaniline
Reason: The structure of m-methoxyaniline is based on an aniline (an amino-substituted benzene) core. Aniline itself has a melting point of -6 degrees Celsius. The methoxy group (-OCH3) is an electron-donating group which generally increases melting point due to improved molecular packing, we might consider this effect to be around +5 degrees Celsius. The amino group (-NH2) is also an electron-donating group, reinforcing the aromatic system and further increasing the melting point, let's consider this effect to be similar to that of the methoxy group, adding another +5 degrees Celsius.
Test (Predicted reason):
- Basic unit, aniline, has a melting point of 6°C. 
- The methoxy group (-OCH3) is an electron-donating group that can participate in hydrogen bonding, which generally increases the melting point. However, the methoxy group also introduces steric hindrance, which can lower the melting point. The net effect of the methoxy group is expected to be a decrease in the melting point. 
- The decrease due to the methoxy group can be estimated to be around -20°C.
